thread.title: Manchester United twist: Wayne Rooney unlikely to move to China - This is why
thread.title_full: Manchester United twist: Wayne Rooney unlikely to move to China - This is why

title: Manchester United twist: Wayne Rooney unlikely to move to China - This is why
text: Manchester United twist: Wayne Rooney unlikely to move to China - This is why Wayne Rooney is highly unlikely to move to China before next week's transfer deadline. PUBLISHED: 00:00, Wed, Feb 22, 2017 | UPDATED: 19:09, Wed, Feb 22, 2017 GETTY Wayne Rooney will be staying at Manchester United at least until the end of the season A move to the Far East is still a possibility in the summer if Wayne Rooney decides to bring the down the curtain on his Manchester United career after 13 years - but he will heed the experience of former team-mate Carlos Tevez. Reports in Argentina claim that Tevez has struggled to settle in China and wants to return to Boca Juniors just three months after joining Shanghai Shenhua for an eye-watering weekly wage of Â£615,000. GETTY Jose Mourinho does not want to risk depleting his squad any further this season Tevez has so far made one appearance, in Shanghai's 2-0 defeat by Brisbane Roar in the AFC Champions League this month. Rooney is frustrated at no longer being a regular starter at United and may well fall further down the order if Jose Mourinho , whose side progressed to the last 16 of the Europa League after beating St Etienne 4-0 on aggregate, signs his top target Antoine Griezmann from Atletico Madrid this summer. But it is understood there is no animosity between him and Mourinho and with 18 months left on his contract - and a further year's option - he is in no rush to leave, especially with United still chasing honours on four fronts and the prospect of adding to his medal haul. GETTY Mourinho wants to sign Atletico Madrid star Antoine Griezmann in the summer Superstar strikers who could replace Wayne Rooney at Man United Tue, February 21, 2017
